ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study; The code for each individual study
Section I Water/Sanitation
Notes: Section I Water/Sanitation

ElementDescription: Section II Assets
Notes: Section II Assets

ElementDescription: Section III Maternal Education
Notes: Section III Maternal Education

ElementDescription: Section IV Income
Notes: Section IV Income

ElementDescription: WAMI Index Score
Notes: total of wami_i, wami_ii, wami_iii, and wami_iv divided by 32

ElementDescription: Do you have a household water connection (e.g., standard plumbing)?
Notes: 0 = No; 4 = Yes (item entered as score)

ElementDescription: If you do not have a household water connection, then indicate the closest match to the water source for your house
Notes: 0 = Any of (Unprotected well, Unprotected spring, Rivers or ponds, Bottled water, or Tanker truck water); 4 = Any of (Public standpipe, Borehole, Protected dug well, Protected spring, or Rainwater collection)

ElementDescription: Is sewage removed from your house by a household connection to public sewer?
Notes: 0 = No; 4 = Yes (item entered as score)

ElementDescription: If sewage is not removed from your house by a household connection to public sewer, then indicate the closes match to your sewage situation
Notes: 0 = Any of (Public or shared toilet, Open pit toilet, or Bucket toilet); 4 = Any of (Household connection to a sewage disposal tank, Pour-flush toilet, Covered pit toilet, or Ventilated improved pit toilet)

ElementDescription: Which of these do you have? Separate room for a kitchen
Notes: Each item equals one point for Section II: Assets

ElementDescription: Which of these do you have? Household bank account
Notes: Each item equals one point for Section II: Assets

ElementDescription: Which of these do you have? Mattress
Notes: Each item equals one point for Section II: Assets

ElementDescription: Which of these do you have? Refrigerator
Notes: Each item equals one point for Section II: Assets

ElementDescription: Which of these do you have? Television (include computer/laptop/ipad)
Notes: Each item equals one point for Section II: Assets

ElementDescription: Which of these do you have? Table
Notes: Each item equals one point for Section II: Assets

ElementDescription: Which of these do you have? Chair or bench
Notes: Each item equals one point for Section II: Assets

ElementDescription: Which of these do you have? People per room (mean)
Notes: Each item equals one point for Section II: Assets

ElementDescription: How many people live in your house?
How many rooms in your house are used for sleeping?
How many years of education did your mother complete
Notes: 5=5 years Completed 5th grade (Grade School) ;6=6 years Completed 6th grade;7=7 years Completed 7th grade ;8=8 years Completed 8th grade (Middle School)

ElementDescription: How many years of education did your father complete
Notes: 5=5 years Completed 5th grade (Grade School) ;6=6 years Completed 6th grade;7=7 years Completed 7th grade ;8=8 years Completed 8th grade (Middle School)

ElementDescription: How many years of education have you had
Notes: 0 = No Education ;1 = 1st grade ;2 = 2nd grade ;3 = 3rd grade ;4 = 4th grade ; 5=5 years Completed 5th grade (Grade School) ;6=6 years Completed 6th grade;7=7 years Completed 7th grade ;8=8 years Completed 8th grade (Middle School) ;9 = 9th grade ; 10 = 10th grade ; 11 = 11th grade ; 12 = 12th grade OR GED ; 13 = 1 year of college ; 14 = 2 years of college or associates degree ; 15 = 3 years of college ; 16 = bachelor's degree ; 17 = 1 year of graduate school ; 18 = 2 years of graduate school ; 19 = 3 years of graduate school ; 20 = 4+ years of graduate school
